Author: Alright#0419
Content: `git pull` will not update it

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
cd ~/komodo
git checkout beta
git pull
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)
cp ~/komodo/src/komodod ~/pos64staker/komodod
```
stop all the chains you're running with
`komodo-cli -ac_name=CHAIN stop`
then just start them normally

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: how hard would it be to implement a peer whitelist for a private chain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
1) initialize peer whitelist
2) if a new peer connects using a non-whitelist node, disconnect

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: so just basic conf...

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: sweet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is custom code that is needed, but peers need to go through a specific negotiation process and you can easily disconnect from any unauthorized peer, and before they are authorized all they can do is ping and try to authorize

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
@Bernz - Selling LABS 
`GUI support for labs, with easier setup, and the ability to split utxos`
We've discussed this several times (at great length) and the consensus is usually that those that put more work into learning how to manage their UTXOs on their own deserve the "extra" that they get for doing so
It's not exactly "fair" for UserA to learn how things work, properly do things, and UserB can just do the same with a button click or 2

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: This is even more true for LABS than other chains, imo

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: That being said, no one will try to stop you if you choose to spend the hours/days/weeks developing such a tool

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: @Bernz - Selling LABS You can indeed input the same scripts to the CLI in AGAMA settings for LABS as we do for Linux.

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Ive dobe it using the binaries in the verus AGAMA for my ZEXO staker

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: and then walked a friend through it on their Win 10 rig as well where they also stake and mine verus

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: If you can format a sendmany properly to your segid addresses, the CLI field in settings will execute and return your hash

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: then you can use the same field to run setgenerate true 0

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: that starts staking, confirmed by running getmininginfo

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: AND

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: If you want to have more control and less UI...

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: You can issue the param command to launch any coin in daemon form, and watch the cmd window tell you whats happening

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: and then use the cli binary to call the daemon

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Proven working to stake ZEXO both ways

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: and lastly... even if you cant form a proper sendmany to all of your addresses... it was hammered home you can stake on a single or small handful of addresses way better if you arent a 1/64th+ total supply holder

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Like my LABs are only manually single UTXO sent to 7 unique segid addresses

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: one at a time in AGAMA

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: So as Genie said, those with a bigger stake and time would figure out how to get 64 segid addresses and apply their weight to the game... because a 64 segid weight worth having is a large stake in a single coin

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: To help with launching the daemon, AGAMA makes it easy. Launch the coin in AGAMA Native, when loaded click the i INFO button and there is a Copy Params button in the details, click and paste to a notepad to save as a start.bat. Close AGAMA. Then browse to the  folder you put AGAMA, and inside the folder resources\app\assets\bin\win64 are the binaries. You can then use the CMD prompt to cd to that full directory (copy paste the full folder path) then launch... komodod.exe  PASTE THE PARAMS HERE and let it sync.

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: If that worked, save the new bat file to this same folder but edit to add -gen -genproclimit=0 to the end. That will then spawn it as a staking daemon.
